proposed_strategy.name: Validated Group by Character Count
proposed_strategy.description: This strategy combines consecutive major sections (Khandas) into a single chunk, starting a new chunk only when adding the next section would exceed the safety character limit. The provided text contains only one Khanda, which fits entirely within a single chunk.

execution_plan.description: The prefatory Shanti Patha and the complete First Khanda of the First Mundaka.

parsing_instructions.justification: The text is hierarchically organized into Mundakas, which are then subdivided into Khandas. The Khanda represents the primary, self-contained unit of commentary and analysis within a Mundaka.
parsing_instructions.numbering_capture_strategy: The Khanda number is a Sanskrit ordinal (e.g., 'प्रथमः') found within the bolded start pattern header.

start_pattern.description: A new Khanda begins with a bolded heading indicating the Mundaka (in locative case) and the Khanda (in nominative case).

end_pattern.description: The end of a Khanda's commentary is explicitly marked with a concluding phrase that names the Mundaka, Khanda, and commentary.
